linkTarget.anchoringText: Tracer flowback mainly involves two opposite motions of tracer injection and flowback. The basic procedure for tracer flowback includes four consecutive steps (Fig. 1): (1) Tracer slug injection along with fracturing fluid. (2) Tracer-free fracturing fluid chasing period during which the tracer slug moves farther into fractures and matrix. (3) Shut down of the flow for a period during the introducing of a downhole packer for next stage fracturing. (4) Tracer flowback along with the fracturing fluid after the well is opened.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Schematic illustration of the tracer injection and flowback process (modified from Karmakar et al., 2016). The red line is the flow rate of the injection and flowback. Qi is the injection rate and Qp is the flowback rate. The black line is the tracer concentration at the well location.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Schematic illustration of the tracer injection and flowback process (modified from Karmakar et al., 2016). The red line is the flow rate of the injection and flowback. Qi is the injection rate and Qp is the flowback rate. The black line is the tracer concentration at the well location.

linkTarget.bib:
Karmakar et al., 2016
S. Karmakar , J. Ghergut , M. Sauter , 2016. Early-flowback tracer signals for fracture characterization in an EGS developed in deep crystalline and sedimentary formations: a parametric study. Geothermics , 63, 242 252 .

linkTarget.anchoringText: Compared to the marine sedimentary environment of unconventional reservoirs in the United States, the Chinese cases are mainly focused on lacustrine unconventional oil and gas, for instance, the Middle Permian Lucaogou (P2l) Formation is a typical tight reservoir in the Jimusar Sag (JS), Junggar Basin. The Junggar Basin, one of the most oil productive provinces in northwestern China with an exploration area of 130×103 km2 (Wang et al., 2014), it is a large-scale intra-continental superimposed basin developed on Precambrian crystalline basement and Paleozoic metamorphic rocks (Hu et al., 2016; Fig. 2).

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Distribution of tectonic units of the Jimusar Sag (JS), Junggar Basin (after Hu et al., 2016). (a) Regional structural map for China showing the location of Junggar Basin; (b) regional structural map for the Junggar Basin showing the location of the JS; and (c) structure contour map of the P2l Formation (contour values in meters) and the distribution of key exploration wells and oil fields in the JS.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Distribution of tectonic units of the Jimusar Sag (JS), Junggar Basin (after Hu et al., 2016). (a) Regional structural map for China showing the location of Junggar Basin; (b) regional structural map for the Junggar Basin showing the location of the JS; and (c) structure contour map of the P2l Formation (contour values in meters) and the distribution of key exploration wells and oil fields in the JS.

linkTarget.anchoringText: After systematic analysis of shapes of TFPs (totally 50 samples), three typical types of TFPs are observed as shown in Fig. 4 and the related MS event distribution is presented in Fig. 5. In Fig. 4, all the three curves are from the same well.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Assume that N numbers of fractures are connected to the wellbore after fracturing treatments (Fig. 6).

In the F-C chart (Fig. 7), the diagonal line represents the homogeneous fracture networks, and the area away from the diagonal line represents the degree of heterogeneity which is commonly quantified by the Lorentz coefficient LC.

Tracer is injected into the formation along with the fracturing fluid at high pressure, which causes the tracer to invade into tight matrix. We observe that there is a line trend after the peak in the TFP in semilog axis (Fig. 8). In order to eliminate the influence of the matrix on the evaluation results, an exponential function is used to fit the declining trend for some time t > tb.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: The fitting curve by the exponential function.

formatted-caption.caption-text: The fitting curve by the exponential function.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The F-C chart is plotted using Eqs. (11) and (12), and the Lorentz coefficient is calculated using Eq. (10) as shown in Fig. 9a. The fracture network of the 16th stage shows more heterogeneous. Interestingly, the derivative of F-C curve (Fig. 9b) shows more sensitive between the two stages although they seem less different in Fig. 9a. The underlying meaning of the derivative of F-C curve infers the variance of flow velocity within the fracture networks.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: (a) F-C curve; and (b) the derivative of F-C curve.

formatted-caption.caption-text: (a) F-C curve; and (b) the derivative of F-C curve.
